s.text: The Times points out that this non-action could hamstring U.S. efforts to forge a strong U.N. agreement on action against Iraq, and could hurt the IMF's attempts to contain the Asian economic crisis.

The NYT lead is about how Newt Gingrich struck the UN and IMF fundings from a bill to hold them hostage until conservative members can get progress on an unrelated issue--tightening further the current rules against abortion-related uses of federal money.
